clinical_study.brief_title: Booster as an Adjunct to Internet-based Cognitive Behavior Therapy (CBT)
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of an Internet-based Booster Program for Obsessive-compulsive Disorder: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: In this trial, we test if adding an Internet-based booster program to regular Internet-based cognitive behavior therapy (ICBT) is effective for patients with obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).

detailed_description.textblock: Written consent form. Completing ICBT in our previous study: Please see NCT01347099 for more details.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline of obsessions and compulsions after 3, 8 and 20 months after baseline.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months before treatment, 3 weeks after treatment starts, 6 and 18 months after treatment has ended
primary_outcome.description: Yale Brown Obsessive Compulsive Scale (Y‐BOCS). Analysis will examine the frequency of relapse from remission between the groups. Furthermore, frequency of incremental cases of remission will be compared between the groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline of obsessions and compulsions after 8 and 20 months.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months before treatment, 6 and 18 months after treatment has ended

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed consent
- Previously enrolled in our randomized controlled trial testing ICBT for OCD: NCT01347099
Exclusion Criteria:
- Suicidal ideation that could jeopardize participation
